00063 #include "egs_base_geometry.h"

00065 #include<vector>
00066 using std::vector;
00067 
00097 class EGS_UNIONG_EXPORT EGS_UnionGeometry : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00098 
00099 public:
00100 
00104     EGS_UnionGeometry(const vector<EGS_BaseGeometry *> &geoms,
00105                       const int *priorities = 0, const string &Name = "");
00106 
00107     ~EGS_UnionGeometry();
00108 
00109     bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00110         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
00111             return false;
00112         }
00113         int j = ireg/nmax;
00114         return g[j]->isRealRegion(ireg-j*nmax);
00115     };
00116 
00117     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00118         for (int j=0; j<ng; j++) if (g[j]->isInside(x)) {
00119                 return true;
00120             }
00121         return false;
00122     };
00123 
00124     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00125         for (int j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00126             int ij = g[j]->isWhere(x);
00127             if (ij >= 0) {
00128                 return ij + j*nmax;
00129             }
00130         }
00131         return -1;
00132     };
00133 
00134     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00135         return isWhere(x);
00136     };
00137 
00138     int medium(int ireg) const {
00139         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
00140             return -1;
00141         }
00142         int j = ireg/nmax;
00143         return g[j]->medium(ireg-j*nmax);
00144     };
00145 
00146     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00147                EGS_Float &t,int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00148         if (ireg >= 0) {
00149             // we are inside, set current geometry
00150             int jg = ireg/nmax;
00151             // distance to boundary and new region in this geometry.
00152             int inew = g[jg]->howfar(ireg-jg*nmax,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00153             // jgnew is the geometry after the step
00154             int jgnew = inew >= 0 ? jg : -1;
00155             // geometries are now ordered in decreasing priorities.
00156             // Then,
00157             //   - if the particle remains in the current geometry,
00158             //     we only need to check geometries up to jg-1
00159             //     For these geometries the particle must be outside,
00160             //     otherwise it would have been in one of them
00161             //   - if the particle exits the current geometry, then
00162             //     we must also check jg+1...ng-1
00163             for (int j=0; j<jg; j++) {
00164                 int ii = g[j]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00165                 if (ii >= 0) {
00166                     jgnew = j;
00167                     inew = ii;
00168                 }
00169             }
00170             if (inew < 0) {
00171                 // the particle didn't enter any of the higher priority
00172                 // geometries but exits the current one.
00173                 // => we need to check if the particle is in one
00174                 // of the lower priority geometries at the exit point.
00175                 EGS_Vector xnew(x+u*t);
00176                 for (int j=jg+1; j<ng; j++) {
00177                     int ii = g[j]->isWhere(xnew);
00178                     if (ii >= 0) {
00179                         // when exiting jg, particle is in region ii of geometry j
00180                         // we don't need to check other geometries because they
00181                         // have a lower priority.
00182                         jgnew = j;
00183                         inew = ii;
00184                         break;
00185                     }
00186                 }
00187             }
00188             if (inew < 0) {
00189                 return inew;
00190             }
00191             if (newmed) {
00192                 *newmed = g[jgnew]->medium(inew);
00193             }
00194             return inew + jgnew*nmax;
00195         }
00196         // if here, we are currently outside of all geometries in the union.
00197         int jg, inew=-1;
00198         for (int j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00199             int ii = g[j]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00200             if (ii >= 0) {
00201                 jg = j;
00202                 inew = ii;
00203             }
00204         }
00205         return inew < 0 ? -1 : inew + jg*nmax;
00206     };
00207 
00208     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00209         if (ireg >= 0) {
00210             int jg = ireg/nmax;
00211             EGS_Float tmin = g[jg]->hownear(ireg-jg*nmax,x);
00212             if (tmin <= 0) {
00213                 return 0;
00214             }
00215             // tmin is now the perpendicular distance to a boundary
00216             // in the current geometry.
00217             // we need to check all geometries with higher priorities
00218             // i.e., all geometries between 0 and jg-1.
00219             // as their priorities are higher, we know that we are
00220             // outside of such geometries.
00221             for (int j=jg-1; j>=0; --j) {
00222                 EGS_Float t = g[j]->hownear(-1,x);
00223                 if (t < tmin) {
00224                     tmin = t;
00225                     if (tmin <= 0) {
00226                         return 0;
00227                     }
00228                 }
00229             }
00230             return tmin;
00231         }
00232         // if here, we are outside of all geomtries in the union.
00233         EGS_Float tmin = 1e30;
00234         for (int j=ng-1; j>=0; j--) {
00235             EGS_Float t = g[j]->hownear(-1,x);
00236             if (t < tmin) {
00237                 tmin = t;
00238             }
00239             if (tmin <= 0) {
00240                 return 0;
00241             }
00242         }
00243         return tmin;
00244     };
00245 
00246     int getMaxStep() const {
00247         int nstep = 1;
00248         for (int j=0; j<ng; ++j) {
00249             nstep += g[j]->getMaxStep();
00250         }
00251         return nstep;
00252     };
00253 
00254     const string &getType() const {
00255         return type;
00256     };
00257 
00258     void printInfo() const;
00259 
00260     EGS_Float getRelativeRho(int ireg) const {
00261         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg) {
00262             return 1;
00263         }
00264         int jg = ireg/nmax;
00265         return g[jg]->getRelativeRho(ireg-jg*nmax);
00266     };
00267     void setRelativeRho(int start, int end, EGS_Float rho);
00268     void setRelativeRho(EGS_Input *);
00269 
00270     virtual void getLabelRegions(const string &str, vector<int> &regs);
00271 
00272 protected:
00273 
00274     EGS_BaseGeometry **g;     
00275     int              ng;      
00276     int              nmax;    
00277     static string    type;    
00278 
00285     void setMedia(EGS_Input *,int,const int *);
00286 
00287 };
00288 
00289 #endif
